title: 112_s3077
content:
The Act is titled the "Pro Football Hall of Fame Commemorative Coin Act" and includes findings related to the legislation. The Pro Football Hall of Fame's mission is to honor individuals who have made outstanding contributions to professional football, preserve historic documents and artifacts, educate the public about the sport's origin and values, and promote the positive values of football. The Hall of Fame opened on September 7, 1963, with a charter class of 17 players, coaches, and contributors. There are currently 273 members inducted, each represented by a bronze bust, a Hall of Fame gold jacket, and a Hall of Fame ring. The Pro Football Hall of Fame, established in 1963, has 273 members. It has welcomed nearly 9 million visitors and houses the world's largest collection on professional football, including over 20,000 artifacts and 20 million pages of documents. The museum has undergone several expansions and exhibit renovations over the years. The Pro Football Hall of Fame has a vast collection of over 20,000 artifacts and 20 million pages of documents. It reaches a global audience of nearly 15 million people annually through various channels. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins with specific weights, diameters, and compositions. These coins will be legal tender according to the United States Code. The coins minted under this Act will have a diameter of 1.205 inches and be minted to the specifications for half-dollar coins as per section 5112(b) of title 31, United States Code. They will also be legal tender and considered numismatic items under section 5134 of title 31, United States Code. The coins minted under this Act will have a design emblematic of professional football, with inscriptions including the year "2016" and words like "Liberty" and "In God We Trust". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5 of the Act specifies that coins will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities from a single mint facility during a 1-year period starting on January 1, 2016. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS.

The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price including face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount.

SEC. 7. SURCHARGES. All sales of coins issued under this Act include surcharges of $35 per $5 coin, $10 per $1 coin, and $5 per half-dollar coin. Surcharges received are promptly paid to the Pro Football Hall of Fame for construction and renovation. The Hall of Fame is subject to audit requirements for the amounts received. No surcharge may be included if it exceeds the annual commemorative coin program issuance limitation. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance to limit the number of commemorative coin programs issued in a calendar year to avoid exceeding the annual issuance limitation.
